comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: DocumenterTools, GDAL, HTTP, RecipesBase, ZipFile

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

I might, it would be best practices. I'll look into the package, thanks.

So, how should I edit this current PR to have the new bounds?

> So, how should I edit this current PR to have the new bounds?

Push a new commit to your repo adding the new bounds. Then make the `JuliaRegistrator register` comment on that new commit. This will update the existing PR instead of making a new PR.

[noblock]

Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: DocumenterTools. You may find [CompatHelper](https://github.com/bcbi/CompatHelper.jl) helpful for keeping your compat entries up-to-date.

Note: If your package works for the current version `x.y.z` of a dependency `foo`, then a compat entry `foo = x.y.z` implies a compatibility upper bound for packages following semver. You can additionally include earlier versionsyour package is compatible with. See [https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/.] for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.
